content.question: A solid disk rests on a central axle. A string is wound around the disk, which causes the disk to rotate about its axle when pulled with a constant force <math alttext="F sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in Figure 1. The force is exerted on the string until the string completely unwinds and detaches from the disk at time <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. A graph of the net torque as a function of time is shown in Figure 2. How can a student determine what the change in angular momentum of the disk would be between <math alttext="0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> if friction were negligible? Justify your selection.

choices.label: The net torque exerted on the disk during the time interval <math alttext="0 seconds is less than t, which is less than 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="6 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>•</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> . After <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> the net torque, which is the frictional torque <math alttext="tau sub Friction " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>c</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. is <math alttext="negative 6 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">–</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>•</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. Using this information, it can be inferred that the torque <math alttext="tau sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> due to <math alttext="F sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="0 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>•</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> . Therefore, the change in angular momentum from <math alttext="tau sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , if friction were negligible, would be zero.

The net torque exerted on the disk during the time interval <math alttext="0 seconds is less than t, which is less than 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="3 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>•</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. After <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> the net torque, which is the frictional torque <math alttext="tau sub Friction" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>c</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math> , is <math alttext="negative 1 newton meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>•</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. Using this information, it can be inferred that the torque <math alttext="tau sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> due to <math alttext="F sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="2 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>•</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. Therefore, the change in angular momentum from <math alttext="tau sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, if friction were negligible, would be <math alttext="2 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>•</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> multiplied by <math alttext="2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The net torque exerted on the disk during the time interval <math alttext="0 seconds is less than t, which is less than 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="3 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. After <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> the net torque, which is the frictional torque <math alttext="tau sub Friction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>c</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> , is <math alttext="negative one newton meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> . Using this information, it can be inferred that the torque <math alttext="tau sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> due to <math alttext="F sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="4 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> . Therefore, the change in angular momentum from <math alttext="tau sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> , if friction were negligible, would be <math alttext="4 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> multiplied by <math alttext="2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The net torque exerted on the disk during the time interval <math alttext="0 seconds is less than t, which is less than 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="6 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. After <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> the net torque, which is the frictional torque <math alttext="tau sub Friction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>c</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> , is <math alttext="negative 6 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> . Using this information, it can be inferred that the torque <math alttext="tau sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> due to <math alttext="F sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="12 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> . Therefore, the change in angular momentum from <math alttext="tau sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> , if friction were negligible, would be <math alttext="12 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> multiplied by <math alttext="2 seconds " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The net torque exerted on the disk during the time interval <math alttext="0 seconds is less than t, which is less than 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="3 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. After <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> the net torque, which is the frictional torque <math alttext="tau sub Friction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>c</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> , is <math alttext="negative one newton meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> . Using this information, it can be inferred that the torque <math alttext="tau sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> due to <math alttext="F sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="4 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> . Therefore, the change in angular momentum from <math alttext="tau sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> , if friction were negligible, would be <math alttext="4 newton meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> multiplied by <math alttext="2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
